name: places/ChIJg96lihZawokRE-kww7Vn3k0
formattedAddress: 20 Exchange Pl, New York, NY 10005, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 Exchange Pl, New York, NY 10005, USA

originalText.text:
I have lived in 20x for almost four years and I absolutely love it !! I get to see the Statue of Liberty from my home, which is so cool. Moving here from LA - I really need sunlight and I love my home - it’s sunny and gorgeous

I love my home and I wouldn't trade it for anything else. I really appreciate Seb too, he is the building manager, and I deeply appreciate his leadership in streamlining a whole host of things that were important. Seb is kind of like John Wick, you really need him when you need him !!

text.text:

originalText.text:
If you’re thinking about living here, don’t. I’ve lived in the building for five years, and have constantly seen it downgrade in quality. Current management has seriously damaged the safety of residents as well as overall living quality.

Elevator issues aside (which despite what they might claim, no, haven’t been solved), there are several issues such as lack of fire safety, evacuation, and emergency services operations in the building. The “amenities” are often in need of repair, or not accessible at all due to elevator. Cleanliness of the building has also gone down significantly over this past year, with bugs, cockroaches, and even rats appearing in common spaces of the building. It used to be quiet, but now the building is incredibly noisy, especially since lots of residents have had to move to lower floors.

The rent prices are not worth it. Most people still saying good things about this place are probably management lol. To be clear: yes it’s a cute building on the surface, but management themselves do not care about it’s state and especially not the wellbeing of their residents.

After living here for a long time the only good thing I can say about it is that the front desk and maintenance guys are the sweetest. Yes, it used to be great. Used to. Now there is no going back, and if you still choose to live here I truly wish you all the luck and patience.

originalText.text:
I echo everyone's sentiments that the doormen and valets are wonderful. We're lucky to have them. The lobby is gorgeous and the location convenient.

I think my only complaint is the gym. It's a little dated, but the real problem is that it is not cleaned. The floors have hair and dust clumps in the corners. Sometimes it seems they spray everything with what I imagine is a disinfectant, because there is white spray residue on everything. The stairwells can be dirty too. But there are nice gyms in the immediate area if you're willing to pay.

All in all, I enjoy living here. The apartment is great and a better value than neighboring buildings.

All in all, I enjoy living here. The apartment is great and a better value than neighboring buildings.

originalText.text:
Run. It’s cheaper than other places for a reason.

I still have nightmares about my experiences with the elevator falling a couple of flights (this happened on 2 occasions). It’s troubling that management never told tenants why it’s “fixed” and it seems obvious it’s only a matter of time until it happens again.

Why did they break for the better part of a year? And what are you doing to protect people in the future?

originalText.text: Great Building, elevator with issues have been fixed. Doormab and staff are great. Shout out to Justin and Jose.
